frame.name: Statement
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a <fen>Speaker</fen> to address a <fen>Message</fen> to some <fen>Addressee</fen> using language. A number of the words can be used performatively, such as <ment>declare</ment> and <ment>insist</ment>. <ex>I now <t>declare</t> you members of this Society.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target </t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun. <ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn</fex> <t>spoke</t> feelingly about what happened.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn</fex> made a persuasive <t>statement</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn's</fex> <t>statement</t> was quite persuasive.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Addressee</fen> is the person to whom the <fen>Message</fen> is communicated. When this FE is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by "to", or as a direct object. <ex>Evelyn <t>reported</t> <fex name="Add">to me</fex> about what happened.</ex> <ex>Evelyn <t>spoke</t> <fex name="Add">to me</fex> about what happened.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Message</fen> is the FE that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase. <ex>Evelyn <t>said</t> <fex name="Msg">that she was not ready to leave</fex>.</ex> <ex>Evelyn <t>reported</t> <fex name="Msg">the whole incident</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by "about", but in some cases it can appear as a direct object. <ex>Evelyn <t>spoke</t> candidly <fex name="Top">about her past</fex>.</ex> <ex>The teacher <t>mentioned</t> <fex name="Top">the recent campus incidents</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Manner of performing an action</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An act whereby the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a statement. <ex>Bilio <t>commented</t> on the paper <fex name="Mns">by scrawling innumerable post-its in a range of colors and sticking them all over it</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The emotional or physical state of the <fen>Speaker</fen> that leads to their speaking. <ex>He <t>wrote</t> <fex name="ICause">in bitterness</fex> of the treatment the Malloreans had given him.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement. <ex>Kim <t>preached</t> to me <fex name="Medium">over the phone</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Speaker</fen> during the statement. <ex>Let's see if you <t>say</t> that <fex name="Dep">sober</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time when the statement is made.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE specifies the place where the statement takes place. <ex>In some <t>remarks</t> <fex name="Place">at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Occasion
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Occasion</fen> is the reason a public statement is given. <ex>The <fex name="Occasion">New Year</fex> <t>address</t> was well received.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition:
<def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE indicate that the particular Statement event referred to is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. Most expressions of <fen>Particular_iteration</fen> indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
<ex>A further biography Shadowland by William Arnold, published in 1978, <t>asserted</t> <fex name="par">for the first time</fex> that Farmer had been the subject of a transorbital lobotomy</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Epistemic_stance
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE modified the target to indicate the legal- or "by rule" domain within which it is true or operational. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Group
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Group</fen> of <fen>Speaker</fen>s or <fen>Medium</fen>s within which the statement is made.
<ex>Much would be achieved if these were more <fex name="Group">widely</fex> <t>acknowledged</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the Statement event.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

FE.name: Iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>The frame element Iteration is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.</def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: add.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say as a further remark.

lexUnit.name: address.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: speak or write to

lexUnit.name: admission.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a confession.

lexUnit.name: admit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: confess to be true or to be the case.

lexUnit.name: affirm.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: state emphatically or publicly.

lexUnit.name: affirmation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: affirmation is a derivative of affirm

lexUnit.name: allegation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of alleging

lexUnit.name: allege.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: claim that someone has done something wrong, typically without proof.

lexUnit.name: announce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a formal public declaration about a fact, occurrence, or intention.

lexUnit.name: announcement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of announcing

lexUnit.name: assert.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: declare, or state clearly

lexUnit.name: assertion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of asserting

lexUnit.name: attest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: declare that something exists or is the case.

lexUnit.name: aver.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: state or assert to be the case.

lexUnit.name: avow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assert or confess openly

lexUnit.name: caution.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something as a warning

lexUnit.name: claim.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an assertion of the truth of something

lexUnit.name: claim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assert that something is the case.

lexUnit.name: comment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a remark expressing an opinion or reaction

lexUnit.name: comment.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: express an opinion or reaction.

lexUnit.name: concede.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: finally admit or agree that something is true

lexUnit.name: concession.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a usually reluctant acknowledgment of a fact

lexUnit.name: conjecture.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an opinion or conclusion based on incomplete information.

lexUnit.name: conjecture.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form a conjecture.

lexUnit.name: contend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assert.

lexUnit.name: contention.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an assertion.

lexUnit.name: declaration.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a formal or explicit statement or announcement

lexUnit.name: declare.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: announce solemnly or officially; make clearly known.

lexUnit.name: denial.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of denying something.

lexUnit.name: exclaim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cry out suddenly, especially in surprise, anger, or pain.

lexUnit.name: exclamation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: exclamation is a derivative of exclaim

lexUnit.name: explain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make (something) clear by describing it in more detail.

lexUnit.name: gloat.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: contemplate one's own success or another's misfortune with smugness or malignant pleasure.

lexUnit.name: insist.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: demand or state forcefully, without accepting refusal or contradiction.

lexUnit.name: maintain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assert something to be the case.

lexUnit.name: mention.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a reference to someone or something.

lexUnit.name: mention.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: refer to briefly.

lexUnit.name: preach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deliver a religious address to an assembled group of people.

lexUnit.name: proclaim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: announce officially or publicly.

lexUnit.name: proclamation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: proclamation is a derivative of proclaim

lexUnit.name: profess.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: claim that one has (a quality or feeling).

lexUnit.name: pronouncement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pronouncement is a derivative of pronounce

lexUnit.name: proposal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a plan or suggestion

lexUnit.name: propose.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put forward (an idea or plan) for consideration by others.

lexUnit.name: proposition.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an option for future action

lexUnit.name: reaffirm.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: state again as a fact; assert again strongly.

lexUnit.name: recount.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give an account of something.

lexUnit.name: reiterate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something again or repeatedly.

lexUnit.name: relate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give an account of.

lexUnit.name: remark.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a comment

lexUnit.name: remark.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say as a comment; mention.

lexUnit.name: report.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an account given of a matter after investigation or consideration

lexUnit.name: report.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give a spoken or written account of something.

lexUnit.name: say.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter words so as to convey information, an opinion, an instruction, etc.

lexUnit.name: speak.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: say something

lexUnit.name: state.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: express definitely or clearly in speech or writing

lexUnit.name: statement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a definite or clear expression of something in speech or writing

lexUnit.name: suggest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put forward for consideration.

lexUnit.name: talk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: speak in order to give information or express ideas or feelings; converse or communicate by speech.

lexUnit.name: write.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: write and send (a letter) to someone.

lexUnit.name: insistence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: forceful statement

lexUnit.name: deny.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: claim that something is false

lexUnit.name: explanation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of explaining, making something clear

lexUnit.name: venture.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to offer a remark at the risk of being rebuffed or censured for it

lexUnit.name: hazard.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: venture to say

lexUnit.name: pout.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: push one's lips or bottom lip forward as an expression of petulant annoyance or in order to make oneself look sexually attractive.

lexUnit.name: smirk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: smile in an irritatingly smug or silly way.

lexUnit.name: confirm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: give assurance of the validity of something.

lexUnit.name: avowal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an open declaration or confession.

lexUnit.name: acknowledge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: accept or admit the existence or truth of.

lexUnit.name: acknowledgment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of acknowledging.

lexUnit.name: note.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: express an observation, often as a side remark.

lexUnit.name: observe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say; remark

lexUnit.name: refute.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deny (a statement or accusation).

lexUnit.name: describe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give a detailed account in words of.

lexUnit.name: promulgation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a formal proclomation

lexUnit.name: message.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a communication that addresses the speaker's or authors feelings

lexUnit.name: detail.v
lexUnit.definition: Fn: explain in detail

lexUnit.name: tell.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: communicate a story, tale, etc (support only)

lexUnit.name: allow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: concede.
